Key Match Events: Pete Alonso hit a three-run homer in the first inning.
Starling Marte had three doubles, four hits, and three RBI.
Francisco Alvarez had three hits, including an RBI single in the fifth inning.
Jesse Winker hit an RBI triple.
Francisco Lindor hit an RBI triple and a solo home run.
Sean Manaea is set to start for the Mets on five days' rest.
Jack Flaherty allowed eight runs and eight hits in three innings.
The Mets became the first team to not whiff in a postseason game since the Angels in 2002.
Pre-Game Insights: The Mets needed to win to extend their season, understanding it was a do-or-die game.
Manager Carlos Mendoza emphasized the importance of strong bullpen performance.
Flaherty was under the weather and not sharp, leading to a poor performance.
Post-Match Reflections: Pete Alonso expressed pride in the team's resilience after the comeback win.
Manager Carlos Mendoza highlighted the victory as a pivotal moment in their playoff push.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Mets trimmed their series deficit to 3-2 and sent the NLCS back to Los Angeles for Game 6.
The Mets bats batted around in the third inning, opening an 8-1 cushion.
Flaherty failed to strike out a batter for the first time since September 2022.
Others: Freeman returned to the lineup after missing two games due to a sprained right ankle.
Jeff McNeil replaced Jose Iglesias at second base and had two sacrifice flies.
